articles.title: Checking the temperature of the NFL's hottest seats: Barnwell on Mike McDaniel, Justin Fields
articles.summary: Should the Dolphins, Titans or Ravens make coaching changes? Is it time for a QB switch for the Jets? Might the Eagles consider moves in their secondary?

articles.title: Titans fire coach Callahan after 1-5 start in 2025
articles.summary: The Titans have fired Brian Callahan just six games into his second season as the team's head coach. He finishes with a 4-19 record as the team's coach.

articles.title: Dolphins' McDaniel: Tua's comments 'misguided'
articles.summary: Tua Tagovailoa's comments after Sunday's game were "misguided," and his postgame news conference was not "not the forum" to air his concerns, coach Mike McDaniel said Monday.

articles.title: Eagles' pass rush depth takes hit as Smith retires
articles.summary: Eagles veteran edge rusher Za'Darius Smith announced his retirement on social media Monday, marking a sudden departure for a productive player at a position of need for Philadelphia.

articles.title: Tomlin questions Browns' trade of Flacco to Cincy
articles.summary: Steelers coach Mike Tomlin on Monday openly questioned the Browns and general manager Andrew Berry for the decision to execute a midseason trade sending quarterback Joe Flacco to the Bengals, saying, "It doesn't make sense."

articles.title: A day later, Glenn admits Fields took 'step back'
articles.summary: Jets coach Aaron Glenn said Monday that Justin Fields "took a step back" with his performance against the Broncos, a day after he bristled at a question on his quarterback's play in the 13-11 loss.

articles.title: Vrabel focused on wins, not return to Tennessee
articles.summary: Mike Vrabel downplayed his upcoming return to Tennessee, when the New England Patriots visit his former team, the Titans, on Sunday.

articles.title: Godwin, Irving out for banged-up Bucs in Week 7
articles.summary: The Buccaneers will be without Chris Godwin and Bucky Irving when they face the Lions next week in a "Monday Night Football" clash.

articles.title: Sources: Richardson likely out multiple games
articles.summary: Colts QB Anthony Richardson Sr. is likely to miss multiple games after suffering an orbital fracture in a freak pregame incident Sunday, sources told ESPN.

articles.title: 🏈 Reid's 2026 draft QB rankings: Who's No. 1?
articles.summary: Who are the best quarterbacks in the 2026 class? We ranked the top 14 who could get picked -- including a few playing against each other this week.

articles.title: Jayden Daniels and the QB battle that unlocked his greatness
articles.summary: Daniels was third on the depth chart when he transferred to LSU. This is how he won the QB battle and unlocked his potential.

articles.title: Inside Jayden Daniels vs. Caleb Williams 2.0: A year after the Hail Mary
articles.summary: Daniels' numbers aren't as good as last year's while Williams' accuracy remains an issue.

articles.title: Questions, takeaways from NFL Week 6: Patrick Mahomes' 4 total TDs lead Chiefs; Panthers and Chargers win thrillers
articles.summary: Our NFL Nation reporters answer the biggest questions out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 6.

articles.title: Time to bench Justin Fields? Let's overreact to Week 6 games, fantasy performances
articles.summary: We sized up Week 6 overreactions, weighing in on Fields, Drake Maye, the Cowboys' defense and more.

articles.title: Bills coach Sean McDermott has adapted: From taking and giving away playcalling to becoming more personable
articles.summary: A more personable Sean McDermott could lead to a more successful Buffalo Bills team.

articles.title: Why the Falcons are confident Michael Penix Jr. is ready for his MNF debut
articles.summary: Penix is coming off his best game as he rewards the Falcons' faith in taking him in the first round.

articles.title: After miraculous plays and a 5-1 start, Bucs' Mayfield tempers MVP talk
articles.summary: The heroics continue for Tampa Bay's quarterback, even as the injuries mount to his top receiving options.

articles.title: Week 6 winners and losers: Dowdle makes case to keep starting; time to sack Fields?
articles.summary: Rico Dowdle, Jaxon Smith-Njigba and De'Von Achane dazzled with big Week 6 performances, but several of fantasy's most reliable stars early this season had a down week.
